<TITLE>HiSeq X Ten paired end sequencing; GSM2905292: BMPa-1; Homo sapiens; RNA-Seq</TITLE>
<STUDY_REF accession="SRP127624" refname="GSE108571">
<IDENTIFIERS>
<PRIMARY_ID>SRP127624</PRIMARY_ID>
</IDENTIFIERS>
</STUDY_REF>
<DESIGN>
<DESIGN_DESCRIPTION/>
<SAMPLE_DESCRIPTOR accession="SRS2792433">
<IDENTIFIERS>
<PRIMARY_ID>SRS2792433</PRIMARY_ID>
<EXTERNAL_ID namespace="GEO">GSM2905292</EXTERNAL_ID>
</IDENTIFIERS>
</SAMPLE_DESCRIPTOR>
<LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR>
<LIBRARY_STRATEGY>RNA-Seq</LIBRARY_STRATEGY>
<LIBRARY_SOURCE>TRANSCRIPTOMIC</LIBRARY_SOURCE>
<LIBRARY_SELECTION>cDNA</LIBRARY_SELECTION>
<LIBRARY_LAYOUT>
<PAIRED/>
</LIBRARY_LAYOUT>
<LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL>Organoids were minced into small pieces and then digested in 0.25% trypsin, 10 g/ml Dnase, 100 nM TTX, 10 μM DNQX, 50 μM DL-AP5 in HBSS at 37 °C for 20 min and stopped digestion with 100 μg/ml trypsin inhibitor. Single cell suspension was genetrated by pipetting for ~ 25 cycles and filtered through a 45 μm cell strainer. Cells were washed with PBS before counting and sorting. Library construction follows the manufactural standard protocol</LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL>
</LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR>
</DESIGN>

<ILLUMINA>
<INSTRUMENT_MODEL>HiSeq X Ten</INSTRUMENT_MODEL>
</ILLUMINA>
</PLATFORM>
